intro_text: Your patrol catches the scent of a fox.
decline_text: Your patrol decides not to pursue the fox.
success_text: Your patrol finds the fox and drives it away.
s_c shows their strength, leading the fight against the fox until it gives up and runs.
The patrol overcomes the fox and sends it running, thanks to s_c's bravery.
fail_text: Your patrol fails to drive away the fox, but luckily there were no injuries.
s_c means well, but they're overconfident in their attack and the fox manages to sink their teeth into them. The patrol is forced to retreat, forming a defensive ring around the hurt s_c.
The brutish fox overwhelms the small patrol, and r_c falls to its vicious jaws.
r_c will carry their new scar with them from now on, but the fox leaves the clan's territory without further trouble.
history_text: r_c carries a scar from a fox fight.
r_c fell in battle with a fox.

intro_text: Your patrol catches the scent of a fox.
decline_text: Your patrol decides not to pursue the fox.
success_text: Your patrol finds the fox and drives it away.
The patrol mobs the fox, using their number to confuse it and attack it safely until it turns tail and runs.
s_c shows their strength, leading the fight against the fox until it gives up and runs.
The patrol overcomes the fox and sends it running, thanks to s_c's bravery.
fail_text: Your patrol fails to drive away the fox, but fortunately with so many cats to protect each other, no one was injured.
s_c means well, but they're overconfident in their attack and the fox manages to sink their teeth into them. The patrol is forced to retreat, forming a defensive ring around the hurt s_c.
r_c will carry their new scar with them from now on, but the fox leaves the clan's territory without further trouble.
history_text: r_c carries a scar from a fox fight.

intro_text: Your patrol catches the scent of a fox.
decline_text: Your patrol decides not to pursue the fox.
success_text: Your patrol finds the fox and drives it away.
s_c shows their strength, leading the fight against the fox until it gives up and runs.
With incredible bravery, s_c overcomes the fox and sends it running.
fail_text: s_c means well, but they're overconfident in their attack and the fox manages to sink their teeth into them. They escape into a tiny refuge, shivering with fear and blood loss.
The brutish fox overwhelms r_c, who dies a violent and lonesome death.
r_c will carry their new scar with them from now on, and the fox still lurks in c_n territory.
history_text: r_c carries a scar from a solo fox fight.
r_c fell in a solo battle with a fox.

intro_text: While helping gathering herbs, r_c stumbles upon a bush of red berries.
decline_text: r_c decides not to touch the berries.
success_text: Unsure but remembering the kittentales of red deathberries, r_c avoids them.
After careful consideration, r_c recognizes them as strawberries and brings the rare berries  back to the medicine cat's den.
Astutely, s_c recognises the cranberries, and carefully chews off a branch laden with them to bring back to camp - the herb stocks can use this odd fruit.
fail_text: Confidently gathering them and prancing back to camp, r_c is then informed that raspberries aren't a useful medicinal herb.

While plucking them from the bush, r_c feels one of the berries split in their mouth, and a horrible taste coats their tongue. They're rushed back to camp, where the medicine cat might have a chance at saving them from deathberry poisoning.

intro_text: While helping gathering herbs, r_c stumbles upon a bush of red berries.
decline_text: r_c decides not to touch the berries.
success_text: Unsure but remembering the kittentales of red deathberries, r_c avoids them.
Whatever. Identifying them is a medicine cat problem.  r_c plucks the berries and brings them back to camp, where it turns out they're called strawberries.
fail_text: Confidently gathering them and prancing back to camp, r_c is then informed that raspberries aren't a useful medicinal herb.

Whatever. Identifying them is a medicine cat problem.  r_c plucks the berries, several splitting in their mouth, and tries not to gag at the horrible taste - after all, all medicine cat herbs taste horrible. Right? They collapse on the way back to camp, and there's nothing any cat can do for them.

Whatever. Identifying them is a medicine cat problem.  r_c plucks the horrible tasting berries and brings them back to camp, where the medicine cat immediately starts work trying to save them from deathberry poisoning.

intro_text: The patrol finds a nice spot to sun themselves.
decline_text: They decide to stay focused instead.
success_text: The sunlight feels great and the cats have a successful patrol.
The sunlight energizes the cats for a training session.
s_c makes sure everyone gets a good basking spot as the cats pause for a little break before resuming their training.
fail_text: The patrol doesn't get much done because of that.

intro_text: r_c finds a nice spot to sun themselves.
decline_text: They decide to stay focused instead.
success_text: The sunlight feels great and r_c has a successful patrol.
The sunlight energizes r_c for a solo training session.
fail_text: The patrol doesn't get much done because of that.

intro_text: Your patrol has a disagreement and look to p_l to settle the dispute.
decline_text: Your patrol decides to head home.
success_text: p_l manages to skillfully smooth over any disagreement.
p_l listens to both sides, then makes a careful judgment. It keeps no one happy, the mark of an excellent compromise.
Talking everyone down, p_l encourages the patrol to focus on their work collecting nesting material.
p_l nods sympathetically, hearing out every side to the argument, and with their help the patrol feels comfortable, even with their differences.
fail_text: p_l stutters; they don't think they are fit to lead the patrol.
p_l rudely reminds the patrol cats to focus on their star-damned jobs and stop quarreling like kittens.

intro_text: Your patrol has a disagreement and look to p_l to settle the dispute.
decline_text: Your patrol decides to head home.
success_text: p_l manages to skillfully smooth over any disagreement.
p_l listens to both sides, then makes a careful judgment. It keeps no one happy, the mark of an excellent compromise.
Talking everyone down, p_l encourages the patrol to focus on their work.

p_l has no time for this scat, and pulls the patrol to a halt to remind them that they have a Star-damned job to do, and quarreling like kittens will not be tolerated. The patrol returns to their work collecting nesting material with newfound vigor.
fail_text: p_l stutters; they don't think they are fit to lead the patrol
p_l spends so much time listening sympathetically to every cat that the patrol gets nothing done, and as they return back home the quarrel continues.

intro_text: As the patrol gathers together to train, r_c admits they think they had a vision from StarClan last night.
decline_text: The patrol doesn't talk about the vision.
success_text: The patrol talks to them about whether it was a real vision as they train.
p_l takes r_c aside, giving them the full benefits of p_l's seniority and experience as they discuss r_c's vision.
s_c chooses to train with r_c, the spiritual warrior gently guiding the conversation. r_c feels deeply privileged and far more at peace after confiding in them.
fail_text: No one can make sense of the vision.
r_c notices p_l looking at them enviously, withdraws from the rest of the patrol, and dismisses the dream as unimportant.

intro_text: As they head out to work on their skills, r_c thinks about the dream they had last night . . . was it sent by Starclan?
decline_text: They push it from their mind.
success_text: It definitely distracts them from their training, but r_c uses the time by themselves to put their thoughts in order. It was a sign from their ancestors. Now they need to figure out what to do next.

Somehow training brings r_c to almost a meditative state, and not only are they fairly confident of their next steps having been given this vision, but they also take the opportunity to improve on a skill they think they're weak at.

s_c often feels like Starclan walks with them, and this is just another instance on the path. They use the solo patrol to collect their thoughts, and by the time they pad home with a hard day's training done, they're ready for the next step their vision hinted at.
fail_text: r_c can't make sense of the vision.

intro_text: The patrol quickly devolves into ghost stories, leaving everyone on edge.
decline_text: p_l quickly silences any talk about ghosts.
success_text: Despite the tense mood, the patrol is successful.
r_c spins a thrilling tale, and the patrol shivers with exciting, thrilled fear.

s_c sees the patrol competing to scare each other, and derails it completely. Instead they spin a tale of truth, bringing the story of one of c_n's warrior ancestors to life. With how clear their words are, it's almost like they know the Starclan cat, even though that's impossible.
fail_text: A branch snaps and the whole patrol runs back to camp.

intro_text: The patrol quickly devolves into ghost stories, leaving everyone on edge.
decline_text: p_l quickly silences any talk about ghosts.
success_text: p_l and r_c wind each other up, making up story after story in ever increasing tales of horror, until finally one sounds a little too ridiculous and both of them nearly fall over laughing, the tension erased as they giggle.
r_c wonders aloud if one of the ghost stories is true . . . the other cats gather close and comfort them. Time for the silly game to end, before someone actually gets upset.

s_c looks around, and with a deep breath, shakes off the tense vibe. Instead they start telling tall tales of long ago cats, completely disregarding anything approaching truth, so that the other cats on patrol start laughing and purring again.
fail_text: r_c tries to look brave in front of the other cats, but hears a rustle behind them and startles so badly they fall over.
p_l makes fun of r_c for being so scared.

intro_text: r_c is tempted to eat the prey they just caught. After all, they're only practicing hunting, right? So this is theirs, it doesn't count as a true hunting patrol?
decline_text: r_c decides against breaking the warrior code, resisting the temptation.
success_text: They eat the prey without anyone noticing.
Whatever, it's not a big deal, and r_c's hungry. They polish off the little snack, and keep working on their pounce.
fail_text: r_c eats the prey, but later they feel terrible about it, slinking around guilty and ashamed for the rest of the day.
r_c freezes in indecision, and eventually a warrior spots them sitting under cover with their prey and accuses r_c of eating it anyway.

intro_text: r_c is tempted to eat the prey they just caught. After all, they're only practicing hunting, right? So this is theirs, it doesn't count as a true hunting patrol?
decline_text: r_c decides against breaking the warrior code, resisting the temptation.
success_text: They eat the prey without anyone noticing.
r_c freezes in indecision. But the moment of peace allows them to collect their thoughts, and decide that the warrior code matters more to them than a silly afternoon snack.
fail_text: r_c eats the prey, but later they feel terrible about it, slinking around guilty and ashamed for the rest of the day.
Whatever, it's not a big deal, and r_c's hungry. But as they eat, a passing warrior spots them, and begins an outraged lecture on the values of the warrior code.

intro_text: r_c is tempted to eat the prey they just caught. After all, they're only practicing hunting, right? So this is theirs, it doesn't count as a true hunting patrol?
decline_text: r_c decides against breaking the warrior code, resisting the temptation.
success_text: They eat the prey without anyone noticing.
It definitely doesn't count as a proper hunting patrol. But just to be safe, r_c chooses to eat their afternoon snack under cover.
fail_text: r_c eats the prey, but later they feel terrible about it, slinking around guilty and ashamed for the rest of the day.

r_c ignores their rumbling belly, and dutifully brings the prey back to camp, only for their mentor to tell them to pick out a bite to eat before their stomach wakes every cat in camp. This would've all been much quicker if they'd eaten it when they first caught it.

intro_text: r_c is tempted to eat the prey they just caught. After all, they're only practicing hunting, right? So this is theirs, it doesn't count as a true hunting patrol?
decline_text: r_c decides against breaking the warrior code, resisting the temptation.
success_text: They eat the prey without anyone noticing.

r_c ignores their rumbling belly, and dutifully brings the prey back to camp. Their mentor congratulates them on the catch, and they get to share it with all their friends, feeling a warm glow in their heart at feeding their clan.
fail_text: r_c eats the prey, but later they feel terrible about it, slinking around guilty and ashamed for the rest of the day.
It definitely doesn't count as a proper hunting patrol. But irritatingly the warrior that comes past and spots r_c eating doesn't seem to agree, and a surly r_c is brought back to camp for a lecture.

intro_text: p_l suggests this might be a good chance for the cats to practice teamwork.
decline_text: They decide to focus on working on a different skill instead.
success_text: Everyone has a nice practice session and their coordination with their Clanmates grows stronger.

s_c takes charge and coordinates exercises for the training patrol. Soon cats are using each other as springboards, practicing breaking a clanmates' fall, and working on treading exactly in each other's pawsteps.
fail_text: Unfortunately, no one steps up to teach.

intro_text: p_l suggests this might be a good chance to practice teamwork with r_c.
decline_text: They decide to focus on working on a different skill instead.
success_text: Both cats have a nice practice session and their coordination with each other grows stronger.
s_c takes charge and coordinates exercises for the duo. They practice mirroring each other, until by the end of the afternoon they can almost act as one cat.
fail_text: Unfortunately, no one steps up to teach.

s_c takes charge and coordinates exercises for the duo. They practice mirroring each other, until by the end of the afternoon they can almost act as one cat. The warrior praises how quickly r_c picks it up, and the apprentice comes back to camp fluffed up with pride.

success_text: Everyone has a nice practice session, picking up a nice selection of new tricks to try out on their next hunting patrol.
s_c takes charge and coordinates exercises for the training patrol. Soon cats are practicing their stalking on each other, sharing tips about different terrain types, and discussing prey selection.
fail_text: Unfortunately, no one steps up to teach.

intro_text: Your patrol catches the scent of a fox.
decline_text: Your patrol decides not to pursue the fox.
success_text: The vixen smells of milk, and hopefully by driving her out of the territory, her litter this Newleaf won't be a threat to the clan.
Your patrol drives away the fox, seeks out her den, and kills her young cubs.
s_c displays incredible skill, driving the mother vixen out of the territory almost by themselves. Now neither the fox nor her cubs pose a threat to the clan.
The patrol overcomes the vixen and drives her off thanks to a brilliant battle move by s_c at a critical moment.
fail_text: The mother fox is vicious and determined, and the small patrol is beaten back.
s_c is determined to win, but their confidence is misplaced, and the vixen manages to sink her teeth into them. The patrol rallies around s_c, but they have to give up the fight.
Never threaten a mother's young - the vixen kills r_c in the skirmish.
The mother fox's snapping jaws leave a permanent mark on r_c, and force the patrol to back off.
history_text: r_c carries a scar from a fox fight.
r_c fell in battle with a fox.

intro_text: Your patrol catches the scent of a fox.
decline_text: Your patrol decides not to pursue the fox.
success_text: Led by p_l, and with a heap of cooperation and teamwork, the patrol drives away the fox, seeks out her den, and kills her young cubs.
With so many cats working together in tight coordination, they manage to accomplish the near-impossible, killing the mother vixen and ending the threat to the clan that she and her cubs pose.
s_c displays incredible skill, driving the mother vixen out of the territory almost by themselves. Now neither the fox nor her cubs pose a threat to the clan.
The patrol overcomes the vixen and drives her off thanks to a brilliant battle move by s_c at a critical moment.
fail_text: The mother fox is vicious and determined, but although they lose this battle, through teamwork the cats manage to retreat without injury.
s_c is determined to win, but their confidence is misplaced, and the vixen manages to sink her teeth into them. The patrol rallies around s_c, but they have to give up the fight.
r_c is left with a small scar, as the patrol and the mother vixen fight to a stalemate.
history_text: r_c carries a scar from a fox fight.

intro_text: Your patrol catches the scent of a fox.
decline_text: Your patrol decides not to pursue the fox.

A brilliant battle move by s_c at a critical moment knocks the vixen off balance, and s_c manages to drive her out of c_n territory, though it takes every spark of strength in their pelt to do it.
fail_text: s_c is determined to win, but the vixen is determined to live, and that makes all the difference. s_c ends up pinned in a defensible hiding spot, bleeding and terrified, until the vixen judges them no longer a threat and continues on her way.

s_c displays incredible skill, driving the mother vixen out of the territory all by themselves. Now neither the fox nor her cubs pose a threat to the clan.
A brilliant battle move by s_c at a critical moment knocks the vixen off balance, and s_c manages to drive her out of c_n territory, though it takes every spark of strength in their pelt to do it.
fail_text: s_c is determined to win, but the vixen is determined to live, and that makes all the difference. s_c ends up pinned in a defensible hiding spot, bleeding and terrified, until the vixen judges them no longer a threat and continues on her way.
Never threaten a mother's young - the vixen kills r_c in the skirmish, and carries off the body to feed her litter.
The mother fox's snapping jaws leave a permanent mark on r_c, and force the patrol to back off.
history_text: r_c carries a scar from a solo fight with a vixen.
r_c fell in a solo battle with a vixen.
